An independent contractor may not operate more than one taxicab pursuant to a lease agreement with a certificate holder during any one 24-hour period. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate holder who leases a taxicab to an independent contractor is jointly and severally liable with the independent contractor for any violation of the provisions of this chapter or the regulations adopted pursuant thereto or, if applicable,chapter 706Aof NRS or the regulations adopted pursuant thereto, and shall ensure that the independent contractor complies with such provisions and regulations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Taxicab Authority or any of its employees may intervene in a civil action involving a lease agreement entered into pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A certificate holder may not have a number of unexpired leases that exceeds the number of taxicabs allocated to the certificate holder pursuant toNRS 706.8824and706.88245.

section.heading: Use of fully autonomous vehicles.

content.p: The fully autonomous vehicles comply with the provisions ofchapter 482Aof NRS and the regulations adopted pursuant thereto; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The certificate holder holds a permit issued pursuant toNRS 706B.130as an autonomous vehicle network company and a permit to use autonomous vehicles to provide transportation services pursuant toNRS 706B.110; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The fully autonomous vehicles will comply with the requirements ofNRS 706.881to706.885, inclusive, and any regulations adopted pursuant thereto.

section.heading: Driverï¿½s permit: Issuance; fingerprints and qualifications of applicant; grounds for refusal to issue permit; fees.

content.p: The Administrator shall issue a driverï¿½s permit to qualified persons who wish to be employed by certificate holders as taxicab drivers. Before issuing a driverï¿½s permit, the Administrator shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Require the applicant to submit a complete set of the applicantï¿½s fingerprints which the Administrator may forward to the Central Repository for Nevada Records of Criminal History for submission to the Federal Bureau of Investigation to ascertain whether the applicant has a criminal record and the nature of any such record, and shall further investigate the applicantï¿½s background; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Require proof that the applicant: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is a resident of this State or a state that adjoins the county in which the applicant has applied for a driverï¿½s permit; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Can read and orally communicate in the English language; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has a valid license issued underNRS 483.325which authorizes the applicant to drive a taxicab in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Administrator may refuse to issue a driverï¿½s permit if the applicant has been convicted of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A felony relating to the practice of taxicab drivers in this State or any other jurisdiction at any time before the date of the application; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A violation ofNRS 484C.110,484C.120or484C.430or a law of any other jurisdiction that prohibits the same or similar conduct within 3 years before the date of the application; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A violation ofNRS 484C.130or a law of any other jurisdiction that prohibits the same or similar conduct. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Administrator may refuse to issue a driverï¿½s permit if the Administrator, after the background investigation of the applicant, determines that the applicant is morally unfit or if the issuance of the driverï¿½s permit would be detrimental to public health, welfare or safety. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A taxicab driver shall pay to the Administrator, in advance, $40 for an original driverï¿½s permit and $10 for a renewal.

section.heading: Medical examinerï¿½s certificate: Required before application for employment; issuance and contents; expiration and renewal.

content.p: Before applying to a certificate holder for employment as a driver, a person must obtain a medical examinerï¿½s certificate with two copies thereof from a medical examiner who is licensed to practice in the State of Nevada. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A medical examiner shall issue the certificate and copies described in subsection 1 if the medical examiner finds that a prospective driver meets the health requirements established by the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations, 49 C.F.R. ï¿½ï¿½ 391.41 et seq. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The certificate described in subsection 1 must state that the medical examiner has examined the prospective driver and has found that the prospective driver meets the health requirements described in subsection 2. The certificate must be signed and dated by the medical examiner. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The medical examinerï¿½s certificate required by this section expires 2 years after the date of issuance and may be renewed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As used in this section, ï¿½medical examinerï¿½ means a physician, as defined inNRS 0.040, a physician assistant licensed pursuant tochapter 630or633of NRS, an advanced practice registered nurse licensed pursuant toNRS 632.237or a chiropractic physician licensed pursuant tochapter 634of NRS.
A certificate holder shall not employ a driver unless the driver has obtained and has on the driverï¿½s person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A valid driverï¿½s license for the State of Nevada obtained under the provisions ofNRS 483.010to483.630, inclusive; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A copy of a medical examinerï¿½s certificate obtained pursuant toNRS 706.8842; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A driverï¿½s permit issued by the Administrator pursuant to rules and regulations of the Taxicab Authority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate holder shall, at the time the certificate holder employs a driver, provide the driver with a complete copy of the rules and regulations described inNRS 706.8844to706.88499, inclusive, and such other rules and regulations as may be adopted by the Taxicab Authority, and require the driver to sign a statement that the driver has received a copy of the regulations and has read and familiarized himself or herself with the contents thereof.

section.heading: Trip sheets: Duties of driver and certificate holder; criminal penalty.

content.p: A certificate holder shall require the certificate holderï¿½s drivers to keep a daily trip sheet in a form to be prescribed by the Taxicab Authority, including, without limitation, in electronic form. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At the beginning of each period of duty the driver shall record on the driverï¿½s trip sheet: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the taxicab is equipped with a taximeter, the meter readings for total miles, paid miles, trips, units, extra passengers and extra charges; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The odometer reading of the taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
During each period of duty the driver shall record on the driverï¿½s trip sheet: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The time, place of origin and destination of each trip; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of passengers and amount of fare for each trip. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At the end of each period of duty the driver shall record on the driverï¿½s trip sheet: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5, the time at which the driver ended the period of duty by means of a time clock provided by the certificate holder; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the taxicab is equipped with a taximeter, the meter readings for total miles, paid miles, trips, units and extra passengers; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The odometer reading of the taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A driver is not required to record on the driverï¿½s trip sheet the time at which the driver ended the period of duty if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The certificate holder uses an operating system which records the time the driver ends the period of duty electronically; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The time entries recorded by the operating system are available to the Taxicab Authority if requested pursuant to an audit. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate holder shall furnish a trip sheet form for each taxicab operated by a driver during the driverï¿½s period of duty and shall require the drivers to return their completed trip sheets at the end of each period of duty. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate holder shall retain all trip sheets of all drivers in a safe place for a period of 3 years immediately succeeding December 31 of the year to which they respectively pertain and shall make such manifests available for inspection by the Administrator upon reasonable demand. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any driver who maintains a trip sheet in a form less complete than that required by subsection 1 is guilty of a misdemeanor. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Administrator shall prescribe the requirements for the use of an electronic version of a daily trip sheet. If a certificate holder requires its drivers to keep a daily trip sheet in electronic form, the certificate holder may comply with the requirements of this section by maintaining the information collected from the daily trip sheet in a secure database and providing the Administrator with access to the information in the database at regular intervals established by the Administrator and upon reasonable demand. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½time clockï¿½ means a mechanism which records the time at which a driver begins or ends, as applicable, a period of duty by means of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A manual time stamp on the driverï¿½s trip sheet; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An electronically issued time stamp provided by the operating system of the certificate holder.

section.heading: Standards of conduct while on duty.

content.p: Be appropriately dressed by the standards of the taxicab business. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be neat and clean in person and appearance. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Refrain from talking loudly, uttering profanity and from shouting to other drivers. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not have in the driverï¿½s possession a lighted cigar, cigarette or pipe while a passenger is being carried in the taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not chew tobacco or use snuff while a passenger is being carried in the taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Attend the taxicab if it is being held out for hire. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not permit the taxicab to remain at a taxicab stand unless it is being held out for hire. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Discourage passengers from entering or leaving a taxicab from the left side except at the left curb of a one-way street or while the car is parked perpendicularly to a curb. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not load or unload passengers or luggage at an intersection or crosswalk or at any place or in any manner that will interfere with the orderly flow of traffic. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not carry more than two passengers in the front seat of the taxicab or carry more passengers in the back seat of the taxicab than are authorized by the manufacturerï¿½s recommendations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not leave the taxicab unattended with the key in the ignition lock. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Operate the taxicab in accordance with all applicable state and local laws and regulations and with due regard for the safety, comfort and convenience of passengers and of the general public.

section.heading: Prohibited acts concerning destination of passenger.

content.p: Deceive or attempt to deceive any passenger who rides or desires to ride in the driverï¿½s taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Convey or attempt to convey any passenger to a destination other than the one directed by the passenger. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in this section, intentionally take a longer route to the passengerï¿½s destination than is necessary. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fail to comply with the reasonable and lawful requests of the passenger as to speed of travel and route to be taken.

section.heading: Compliance with passengerï¿½s directions; exceptions.

content.p: A driver shall not refuse or neglect to transport any orderly person to that personï¿½s destination if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That person requests the driver to transport the person; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The requested destination is within the area allocated to the certificate holder who employs the driver. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subsection 1 does not apply if the driver can show beyond a reasonable doubt that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The taxicab has been previously engaged by another person; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The driver is forbidden by law or regulation to carry the person requesting transportation.

section.heading: Sanctions imposed by Administrator for certain violations; hearing.

content.p: If a driver violates any provision ofNRS 706.8844to706.8847, inclusive, the Administrator may impose the following sanctions: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
First offense: Warning notice or a fine of not more than $100, or both warning and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Second offense: 1 to 3 daysï¿½ suspension of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $200, or both suspension and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Third offense: 4 to 6 daysï¿½ suspension of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $300, or both suspension and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fourth offense: 10 daysï¿½ suspension of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $500, or both suspension and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fifth offense: Revocation of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $500, or both revocation and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Only violations occurring in the 12 months immediately preceding the most current violation shall be considered for the purposes of subsection 1. The Administrator shall inspect the driverï¿½s record for that period to compute the number of offenses committed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Administrator shall conduct a hearing prior to suspension or revocation of a driverï¿½s permit or imposing a fine under this section orNRS 706.8849.

section.heading: Prohibited and required acts of drivers; imposition of sanctions; hearings.

content.p: If a taxicab is equipped with a taximeter, the taxicab driver shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ensure that the fare indicator on the taximeter of the taxicab reads zero before the time that the taxicab is engaged. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ensure that the taximeter of the taxicab is engaged while the taxicab is on hire. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not make any charge for the transportation of a passenger other than the charge shown on the taximeter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not alter, manipulate, tamper with or disconnect a sealed taximeter or its attachments nor make any change in the mechanical condition of the wheels, tires or gears of a taxicab with intent to cause false registration on the taximeter of the passenger fare. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not permit any person or persons other than the person who has engaged the taxicab to ride therein unless the person who has engaged the taxicab requests that the other person or persons ride in the taxicab. If more than one person is loaded by the taxicab driver as set forth in this paragraph, the driver shall, when one of the persons leaves the taxicab, charge that person the fare on the meter and reset the taximeter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A taxicab driver shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not remove or alter fare schedules which have been posted in the taxicab by the certificate holder. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not drive a taxicab or go on duty while under the influence of, or impaired by, any controlled substance, dangerous drug, or intoxicating liquor or drink intoxicating liquor while on duty. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not use or consume controlled substances or dangerous drugs which impair a personï¿½s ability to operate a motor vehicle at any time, or use or consume any other controlled substances or dangerous drugs at any time except in accordance with a lawfully issued prescription. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not operate a taxicab without a valid driverï¿½s permit issued pursuant toNRS 706.8841and a valid driverï¿½s license issued pursuant toNRS 483.325in the driverï¿½s possession. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Obey all provisions and restrictions of the certificate of public convenience and necessity issued to the driverï¿½s employer or the certificate holder with whom the driver contracts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If a driver violates any provision of subsection 1 or 2, the Administrator may, after a hearing, impose the following sanctions: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For a first offense, 1 to 5 daysï¿½ suspension of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $100, or both suspension and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For a second offense, 6 to 20 daysï¿½ suspension of a driverï¿½s permit or a fine of not more than $300, or both suspension and fine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For a third offense, a fine of not more than $500. ï¿½In addition to the other penalties set forth in this subsection, the Administrator may revoke a driverï¿½s permit for any violation of a provision of paragraph
of subsection 2. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Only violations occurring in the 12 months immediately preceding the most current violation may be considered for the purposes of subsection 3. The Administrator shall inspect the driverï¿½s record for that period to compute the number of offenses committed.

section.heading: Taxicab driver prohibited from acting as driver for transportation network company under certain circumstances; termination of employment.

content.p: A driver who operates a taxicab as an employee of a certificate holder shall not act as a driver as defined inNRS 706A.040: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Using the taxicab provided by his or her employer; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
During any time for which the person receives wages from his or her employer for duties which include the operation of a taxicab. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A certificate holder may terminate the employment of a driver, as defined inNRS 706.8814, who violates the provisions of subsection 1.

section.heading: Unlawful acts; criminal penalties; disciplinary action by Taxicab Authority and Administrator.

content.p: Any person who knowingly makes or causes to be made, either directly or indirectly, a false statement on an application, account or other statement required by the Taxicab Authority or the Administrator or who violates any of the provisions ofNRS 706.881to706.885, inclusive, is guilty of a misdemeanor. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Taxicab Authority or Administrator may at any time, for good cause shown and upon at least 5 daysï¿½ notice to the grantee of any certificate or driverï¿½s permit, and after a hearing unless waived by the grantee, penalize the grantee of a certificate to a maximum amount of $15,000 or penalize the grantee of a driverï¿½s permit to a maximum amount of $500 or suspend or revoke the certificate or driverï¿½s permit granted by the Taxicab Authority or Administrator, respectively, for: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any violation of any provision ofNRS 706.881to706.885, inclusive, or any regulation of the Taxicab Authority or Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Knowingly permitting or requiring any employee to violate any provision ofNRS 706.881to706.885, inclusive, or any regulation of the Taxicab Authority or Administrator. ï¿½If a penalty is imposed on the grantee of a certificate pursuant to this section, the Taxicab Authority or Administrator may require the grantee to pay the costs of the proceeding, including investigative costs and attorneyï¿½s fees. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

When a driver or certificate holder fails to appear at the time and place stated in the notice for the hearing, the Administrator shall enter a finding of default. Upon a finding of default, the Administrator may suspend or revoke the license, permit or certificate of the person who failed to appear and impose the penalties provided in this chapter. For good cause shown, the Administrator may set aside a finding of default and proceed with the hearing. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any person who operates or permits a taxicab to be operated in passenger service without a certificate of public convenience and necessity issued pursuant toNRS 706.8827, is guilty of a gross misdemeanor. If a law enforcement officer witnesses a violation of this subsection, the law enforcement officer may cause the vehicle to be towed immediately from the scene. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The conviction of a person pursuant to subsection 1 does not bar the Taxicab Authority or Administrator from suspending or revoking any certificate, permit or license of the person convicted. The imposition of a fine or suspension or revocation of any certificate, permit or license by the Taxicab Authority or Administrator does not operate as a defense in any proceeding brought under subsection 1.
